summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a FOIA request from Bloomberg News. The request seeks the identity of a financial institution referred to as 'Institution-1' in a court filing related to Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case. The email suggests the information is likely exempt from disclosure.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case brought by the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York in July 2019; his assets are controlled by an unnamed financial institution.

events.title: Criminal Case Filed Against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York brought a criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court Filing References Unnamed Financial Institution
events.description: A court filing (Document 11) in case 19-cr-00490 references an unnamed financial institution ('Institution-1') controlling Epstein's assets.

keyFacts: A FOIA request from Bloomberg News seeks the name of a financial institution referred to as 'Institution-1' in a July 12, 2019 court filing related to Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York internally notes that the requested information is 'very likely covered by exemption' and thus may not be disclosed.
The court filing (Document 11 in case 19-cr-00490) indicates this unnamed institution controls assets belonging to Jeffrey Epstein.
